metadata.description: Indicate if Hub-Spoke Network should be deployed.
Indicate if Azure Batch Demo should be deployed.
Get the Batch Service Object Id: az ad sp show --id "MicrosoftAzureBatch" --query objectId -o tsv
Select true if Batch Service has not been gratned contributor permissions.
Private access (Recommended) is only available for Premium SKU.

properties.description: Denies the ability to remote desktop onto Azure batch nodes
Denies the ability to ssh onto Azure batch nodes

routes.value: [if(empty(createArray(createObject('name', 'Default', 'properties', createObject('addressPrefix', '0.0.0.0/0', 'nextHopType', 'VirtualAppliance', 'nextHopIpAddress', reference(extensionResourceId(format('/subscriptions/{0}/resourceGroups/{1}', subscription().subscriptionId, parameters('rgHub')), 'Microsoft.Resources/deployments', 'deployAzureFirewall'), '2020-06-01').outputs.fwPrivateIpAddress.value)))), parameters('vNetHubObject').subnets[copyIndex()].routes, union(parameters('vNetHubObject').subnets[copyIndex()].routes, createArray(createObject('name', 'Default', 'properties', createObject('addressPrefix', '0.0.0.0/0', 'nextHopType', 'VirtualAppliance', 'nextHopIpAddress', reference(extensionResourceId(format('/subscriptions/{0}/resourceGroups/{1}', subscription().subscriptionId, parameters('rgHub')), 'Microsoft.Resources/deployments', 'deployAzureFirewall'), '2020-06-01').outputs.fwPrivateIpAddress.value)))))]

metadata.description: Built-in role to assign
A new GUID used to identify the role assignment

accessPolicy.value: [array(createArray(createObject('objectId', reference(resourceId('Microsoft.ManagedIdentity/userAssignedIdentities', variables('batchManagedIdentity'))).principalId, 'permissions', createObject('secrets', createArray('get', 'list', 'set', 'delete', 'recover')), 'tenantId', subscription().tenantId), createObject('objectId', parameters('batchServiceObjectId'), 'permissions', createObject('secrets', createArray('get', 'list', 'set', 'delete', 'recover')), 'tenantId', subscription().tenantId)))]

metadata.description: Required. Name of your Azure container registry
Optional. Enable admin user that have push / pull permission to the registry.
Optional. Location for all resources.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or it's fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'
Optional. Configuration Details for private endpoints.
Optional. Tier of your Azure container registry.
Optional. The value that indicates whether the policy is enabled or not.
Optional. The value that indicates whether the policy is enabled or not.
Optional. The value that indicates whether the policy is enabled or not.
Optional. The number of days to retain an untagged manifest after which it gets purged.
Optional. Enable a single data endpoint per region for serving data. Not relevant in case of disabled public access.
Optional. Whether or not public network access is allowed for the container registry. - Enabled or Disabled
Optional. Whether to allow trusted Azure services to access a network restricted registry. Not relevant in case of public access. - AzureServices or None
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Optional. Enables system assigned managed identity on the resource.
Optional. The ID(s) to assign to the resource.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Customer Usage Attribution ID (GUID). This GUID must be previously registered
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed.
Optional. Specifies the number of days that logs will be kept for; a value of 0 will retain data indefinitely.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account.
Optional. Resource ID of log analytics.
Optional. Resource ID of the event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.
Optional. Name of the event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category.

properties.notes: [if(equals(parameters('lock'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot modify the resource or child resources.')]

The principal ID of the system assigned identity.

Optional. Name of the event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category.
